result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle A Kahl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
with Huber, concurrent to sentence in Count #2

The Def. is ordered to report and serve the sentence  with absolute sobriety and without illegal drugs in his system; failure to comply will result in loss of Huber/work release without further process

miscConds.notes:
--to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay drug testing fees in the amount of $75

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any recommended treatment  as required by Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--to maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substance without valid prescription
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent

Arresting Agency: JCSD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle A Kahl

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DOC Balance Inquiry
Petition and Proposed Stipulation for Civil Judgment for Court Ordered Financial Obligations
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 9:47am [mo]
Defendant Kyle A Kahl in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Mr.Kahl waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Amended Information admitted, reading waived

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of "Guilty" entered on Counts #1 and #2 of the Amended Information; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Count #1 the Court Imposes and STAYS 120 days jail with Huber, concurrent to sentence in Count #2
On Count #2 the Court Imposes and STAYS 30 days jail with Huber, concurrent to sentence in Count #1 
The Def. is ordered to report and serve the sentence  with absolute sobriety and without illegal drugs in his system; failure to comply will result in loss of Huber/work release without further process.

On Counts #1 and #2 the Court STAYS jail sentence and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any recommended treatment as required by Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--to maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substance without valid prescription
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--On Count #1 to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #2 to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--to pay drug testing fees in the amount of $75

Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 10:02am
Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek
Waiver of Prelim on June 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.
The Court concludes the request is timely and in the proper form
